output.conclusion: By the end of this course, you will have a strong understanding of advanced kinematics concepts and be able to apply them to solve complex problems in physics and engineering.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Kinematics! This course builds upon your existing knowledge of kinematics and delves into more complex topics such as non-inertial frames of reference, generalized coordinates, and advanced problem-solving techniques. Get ready to expand your understanding of motion!

chapters.description: A quick recap of displacement, velocity, acceleration, and their relationships in one and two dimensions. Emphasis on vector notation and calculus-based definitions.
Analyzing projectile motion considering air resistance. Introduction to drag forces and their impact on trajectory, range, and time of flight. Numerical methods for solving complex trajectories.

chapters.chapterTitle: Curvilinear Motion: Tangential and Normal Components
chapters.description: Describing motion along curved paths using tangential and normal components of velocity and acceleration. Applications to circular motion and other curved trajectories.
Introduction to non-inertial frames and fictitious forces (e.g., Coriolis force, centrifugal force). Analyzing motion from the perspective of accelerating frames.
Detailed explanation of the Coriolis effect and its applications in meteorology, oceanography, and ballistics. Mathematical derivation and examples.
Kinematics in rotating frames. Transformation of velocity and acceleration between inertial and rotating frames. Applications to rotating machinery and celestial mechanics.
Introduction to generalized coordinates and their use in describing complex systems. Examples include pendulum motion and constrained systems.
Analyzing systems with kinematic constraints (e.g., rolling without slipping). Application of constraint equations to reduce the number of degrees of freedom.
Application of advanced kinematic concepts to solve challenging problems. Examples include robotic arm kinematics and vehicle dynamics.
